main event: Several civilians, including a military officer, reported seeing unusual objects in the sky near Spokane, Washington on July 27, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright white lights, luminous white discs, and a single white disc that looked like a clay pigeon.
The objects were observed moving rapidly, climbing slightly, and making a 360-degree turn.
The objects displayed no trail, exhaust, or sound.
The size of the single white disc was compared to one-sixth the size of a full moon, larger than any star.
The reliability of the civilian witnesses could not be evaluated, but the military officer's reliability was considered good.
sighted object: bright white lights, luminous white discs, single white disc
photographs: no photographs included in the report
